results.title: 150 to the acre
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), James Allen, Jean Hunt, Murray Brown and Robert Newton
results.brief_description: Discusses the problems arising from living in high-rise developments. These include high noise-levels and lack of playing-space for children. An architect shows plans for high-density housing which should overcome these problems while still providing housing for many people in relatively small areas. Set in Melbourne, Victoria. Narrated by Wynn Roberts. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: 15 Amore
results.creator_credit: MTXM Movies, Maurice Murphy and Brooke Wilson
results.brief_description: Based on the director/writer’s own childhood experiences, this period drama is set in an idyllic rural Australia during World War II when two Italian POW’s, a Jewish German woman and her daughter are billeted with a farmer’s wife and her three children on an isolated farmstead. Told from the point-of-view of a young boy, the daily existence of the characters as they grow closer to one another, seems harmonious and carefree. Yet beneath this tranquility simmers war- induced trauma, fear and cynicism which inevitably erupts. A perceptive look at cultural difference, this beautifully photographed film avoids slipping into nostalgia and stereotype by staying focused on the characters’ motivations and conflicting emotional states. Cast: Lisa Hensley, Steve Bastoni, Domenic Galati, Tara Jakszewicz, Gertrude Ingeborg, Rhianna Griffith, Bill Hunter. Photography by John Borck. Music by Carlo Giacco.

results.title: 147 break
results.creator_credit: Paul Doherty, Granada Television International and Eric Harrison
results.brief_description: Steve Davis became the first man in history to pot 15 reds, 15 blacks, plus all the colours in sequence under tournament conditions on television. This thrilling achievement is seen through Steve’s own eyes as he talks the viewer through the most difficult moments. Reminiscent of the “Pot Black” series and a must for snooker lovers.

results.title: 146,000 could live
results.brief_description: Dramatically presents each of the seven danger signals for cancer. Five are represented by people cured of cancer, one by a woman who lost her son to cancer and one by a man who notices a danger signal but found, when he went to a doctor, that he did not have cancer. Originally presented on television. Narrated by Charles S. Cameron.

results.title: 13th World Jamboree
results.creator_credit: Takeshi Hojo, Nikkei Films and Yoshifuru Takeichi
results.brief_description: The founder of scouting, Lord Baden Powell, was most impressed by Japan, and sixty years later the 13th World Jamboree was held on foothills of Mt. Fuji. Scouts from all over the world occupied seven thousand multicoloured tents for nine days. The theme was: “For Understanding” and to bring this about scouts demonstrated their various skills.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Takeshi Hojo, Nikkei Films and Yoshifuru Takeichi

results.title: 13 cantos of hell: images from the divine comedy of Dante
results.creator_credit: Experimental Committee of the British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An animated film based on episodes from Dante’s Inferno. The film is the work of the young artist Peter King, who was formerly associated with Lotte Reininger, famous for her silhouette films. A similar technique is used in this film in which the animated figures have a sculptural form. They display a highly individual visual imagination complemented by compelling sound.
results.title_for_label: 13 cantos of hell: images from the divine comedy of Dante

results.title: 12th Tokyo Motor Show: 1965
results.brief_description: The annual Tokyo Motor Show displays the progress of the Japanese motor industry to the nation and visitors from overseas. A wide variety of vehicles are manufactured in Japan and this annual event creates great interest from business people and car enthusiasts. Planned by the Japan Motor Industrial Federation.

results.title: 12,000 men
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer, ONF | NFB and Martin Duckworth
results.brief_description: This powerful documentary brings alive the brave story of Cape Breton’s union struggles in the coal and steel industries from the 1890s through the labour wars of the 1920s. The fight for decent wages and improved working conditions took on an urgency when the British Empire Steel Corporation, or BESCO, bought every single steel and coal company in Nova Scotia. When the Montreal-based company cut wages by a third, a long and bitter dispute began. The lockouts, picket lines and strikes were finally ended by brute force when provincial police and federal troops were sent in. The mine owners, however, were ultimately forced to recognize the union. This film combines vintage footage, photographs, drawings and interviews with men and women who were actually in the pits and on the front lines. These Cape Bretoners speak of the hardship and brief victories of the coal miners and their families. Photography by Martin Duckworth. Editing by Martin Duckworth and Shelagh Mackenzie. Sound by Patricia Kipping. Voice and narration by Kenzie MacNeil. (Awards: Yorkton)

results.title: 11.59: last minute to choose
results.brief_description: A study of the social and psychological factors involved in drug abuse. Various sections of the drug culture are contrasted using split screen techniques. “11:59” brings you into the hospital emergency room, the teenagers are shown in frank discussion groups, exploring attitudes and seeking solutions. WARNING: Contains footage of drug use, overdose and emergency treatment in hospitals.

results.title: 11 09 01: September 11
results.creator_credit: Galatee Films, Studio Canal, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shohei Imamura, Claude Lelouch, Ken Loach, Mira Nair, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Sean Penn, Samira Makhmalbaf, Danis Tanovic and Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu
results.brief_description: Eleven renowned directors were given the brief to create a short films that in some way responded to the tragic events of September 11, 2001, when America was thrown into disarray by the terrorist attacks on, among other targets, the Twin Towers. The only proviso was that each film be eleven minutes, nine seconds and one frame long. The directors invited to participate were: Yussef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shohei Imamura, Claude Lelouch, Ken Loach, Mira Nair, Idrissa Ouedraogo, Sean Penn, Samira Makhmalbaf, Danis Tanovic, and Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu. The results are very mixed — from the abstract to the obvious — and the overall piece did not meet with great acclaim. Regardless, the project has some insightful moments, in particular, the segments from Ken Loach, Mira Nair and Samira Makhmalbaf.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Galatee Films, Studio Canal, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shohei Imamura, Claude Lelouch, Ken Loach, Mira Nair, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Sean Penn, Samira Makhmalbaf, Danis Tanovic and Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu
